citation.article-title: Marinospirillum gen. nov., with descriptions of Marinospirillum megaterium sp. nov., isolated from kusaya gravy, and transfer of Oceanospirillum minutulum to Marinospirillum minutulum comb. nov.

p.s: Description of Marinospirillum megaterium sp. nov.
Marinospirillum megaterium (me.ga.te'ri.um. Gr. adj. mega large; Gr. n. teras, teratis monster, beast; M.L. n. megaterium big beast)
In addition to those given above in the description of the genus, M. megaterium has the following characteristics.
Rigid helical shaped cells are 0.8-1.2 μm in diameter by 5-15 μm in length and thin-wall coccoid bodies are 2-0-2.5 μm in diameter.
NaCl is required for growth; growth occurs at NaCl concentrations of 0-5-9.0% (w/v) and is optimal at 3% NaCl.
The temperature range for growth is 4-25 OC, with an optimum of 20-25°C.
The pH range for growth is 7.5-9.0, with an optimum of pH 8-0.
Cells cannot grow in liquid media in static or aerobic conditions with vigorous shaking or on plate surfaces.
Gelatin, hippurate and starch are not hydrolysed.
DNase, RNase, urease and phosphatase are not produced.
The DNA G+C content is 44-45 mol%.
The type strain is strain H7T (=JCM 10129T), which was isolated from kusaya gravy.
